INFOS ENGLISH 

The Legend Live - Santa Barbara County Bowl - 25th November 1979

The County of Santa Barbara Bowl, Greek Theater in rural California was far from a Marley concert in the open air summer month of November. Was it the mercy of the Pacific coast in the afternoon, the smell that haloed places in a micro-climate ...?

Filmed in a linear fashion (one would like to see a little more soloists rather than the ubiquitous Bob), more or less in chronological order (sometimes it got dark and then again days), the film listen more it looks. The band on stage is impressive (fifteen persons) and one hears of beautiful guitars, Junior Marvin and Al Anderson ( "Ambush in the Night," "Stir it up", almost rock on "Wake up and live" in space takeoff on "Ride Natty Ride").

A concert reminiscent of the Rainbow during the tour "Exodus" two years ago, "Exodus" - the song - being worn by the metronomic drum Carlton Barrett, the Family Man bass, Hammond organ and brass obviously a highlight of the concert with "I shot the sheriff," "Is This Love," "Stir It Up" and the final "Get Up Stand Up". But I personally have a soft spot for the haunting and hypnotic "Ride Natty Ride" (a synth sound a little ringu but what guitar!)
